intro: Thapsia villosa var. villosa, commonly known as the woolly thapsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green foliage and umbel-like inflorescences that produce small, white to yellowish flowers. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and full sun conditions. It is often found in coastal areas and can tolerate saline environments. The plant's aromatic leaves and flowers have been historically used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
